feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 7:19AM AKDT until October 15 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 7:19AM AKDT until October 16 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Sunday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Sunday Night Through Monday Night. ... Northeast winds gusting to 40 mph will cause elevated water levels and elevated surf along the coast from Point Barrow to Wainwright Sunday night through Monday night. High surf is possible. The surf is expected to decrease early Tuesday as winds decrease. Beach erosion is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Possible Sunday And Sunday Night... East winds gusting to 55 mph will cause elevated water levels and elevated surf along the coast starting early Sunday. High surf is possible. The surf is expected to decrease early Monday as winds turn offshore and decrease. Beach erosion is expected. Waves could wash onto the Dock at Prudhoe Bay.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:42AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Rain Possible This Weekend Over the Eastern Interior... A strong storm in the Gulf of Alaska will makes its way north over the Central Interior on Sunday. This will bring a slight chance of freezing rain to the southern Interior today, with a chance of freezing rain tonight and Sunday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 12:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MORE HEAVY RAIN THIS WEEKEND FOR NORTHERN SOUTHEAST ALASKA... Moderate to heavy rain has spread over the northern panhandle and will begin diminishing late Saturday morning. Over the northeast Gulf Coast moderate to heavy rain will persist through the weekend. Rainfall totals will range from less than an inch over the far northern inner channels to more than 2 inches along the northeast

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 11:35AM MST until October 15 at 12:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 1135 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms which produced heavy rain from Oatman to Fort Mohave. Flash flooding is possible in these areas. More thunderstorms approaching from the east could also continue the flash flood threat.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 10:13AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Fire Danger in Portions of North Central Iowa Today... Gusty west to northwest winds and dry air will combine to create near critical fire weather conditions over portions of north central Iowa today. The time period of concern is between Noon and 6pm when peak wind gusts are expected to approach 30 mph while RH values fall to near 25 percent.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:41AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER DANGER EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... Warmer temperatures, low humidity, and breezy winds will generate near critical fire danger this afternoon. entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...East winds will accelerate through canyons within the central mountains, including Tijeras Canyon and Bear Canyon. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 12:03PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT MONDAY... The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has continued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 5 PM PDT Monday. An Air Quality Advisory for Smoke remains in effect. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels at times through Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 2:41AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER DANGER EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... Warmer temperatures, low humidity, and breezy winds will generate near critical fire danger this afternoon. The worst conditions will take place between noon and 7 pm today. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass or crop fires. Use extra caution

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 14 at 3:11PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: An Air Quality Alert has been issued by the Washington Department of Ecology in Yakima at least through Monday for Okanogan, Chelan, and Douglas counties. Particulate matter (PM2.5) levels may vary from unhealthy to hazardous at times close to the current wildfires in Chelan and western Okanogan counties.
